meanings.definition: A person who bands or ties things together.
meanings.sent1: The banders carefully tied the packages together for shipping.
meanings.sent2: I hired a banders to help me organize my messy cables.
meanings.sent3: The banders at the post office had a competition to see who could tie the fastest.
meanings.sent4: She was like a skilled banders, bringing people together with her warm personality.
meanings.sent5: The banders skillfully weaved the colorful ribbons into a beautiful bow.

meanings.definition: A device used for banding or tying things together.
meanings.sent1: The banders on the machine snapped shut securely around the boxes.
meanings.sent2: I need to buy a new banders to keep my papers organized.
meanings.sent3: The banders in the tool shed were all rusty and needed to be replaced.
meanings.sent4: The banders worked like magic, holding the pieces together with ease.
meanings.sent5: With a click, the banders locked the two ends of the belt in place.

meanings.definition: A group of people who have a common interest or purpose.
meanings.sent1: Our book club is a close-knit banders that meets every week.
meanings.sent2: The banders of volunteers worked tirelessly to clean up the park.
meanings.sent3: The banders of friends decided to start a gardening project together.
meanings.sent4: The banders of students organized a charity event to help those in need.
meanings.sent5: Being part of a banders can bring a sense of belonging and camaraderie.
